#summary Description about advanced features

= Advanced RIGHT =
In this page, you can learn advanced RIGHT features with few example codes.
 * Multiple graphs 
 * Fitting lines

== 1. Drawing multiple graphs ==

You can draw multiple graphs in one page very easily. If you want to draw three grahps, just type like below : 

{{{
> RIGHT({plot(price ~ color, subArray, type = "p")
        hist(color, subArray)
        pie(color, subArray)}, subArray, dir="TEMP", isOverwrite = TRUE)
}}}

It will show three interactive graphs like below. From left, _plot_ draw a scatter graph, _hist_ draws a bar graph, and finally _pie_ draws a pie graph.

<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/advanced01.PNG">

All graphs, of course, are interactively connected.

<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/advanced02.PNG">


== 2. Fitting Lines == 

You can build a fitting line to nodes. To get the fitting line, follow this example code : 

{{{
library(ggplot2)
rm(list = ls())

set.seed(123456)

subArray <- diamonds[sample(1:nrow(diamonds), 1000, TRUE), ]

fitObj <- loess(price ~ carat, subArray)
xRange <- range(subArray$carat)
fitArray <- data.frame(carat = seq(xRange[1], xRange[2], length.out = 100))
fitArray$price <- predict(fitObj, newdata = fitArray)

# ggplot:
print(ggplot(NULL, aes(x = carat, y = price)) + 
        geom_point(data = subArray, color = "green", size = 2) +
        geom_line(data = fitArray, color = "black", size = 1.2))

# RIGHT:
print(RIGHT({plot(price ~ carat, subArray, type = "p")
             lines(price ~ carat, fitArray)}, 
            subArray, fitArray, 
            dir = "TEMP",
            isOverwrite = TRUE))
}}}

You can check the result from ggplot. But, this is not interactive at all.

<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/advanced05.PNG">


RIGHT will show the same, but interactive one on your browser.

<img src="http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/advanced04.PNG">
